q: top of the company". Larry Page, who founded the company with Sergey Brin , will now run the company in the CEO role with Eric Schmidt moving to an "executive chairman" position. Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's chief executive officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly , says Eric Schmidt before adding: "I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! Inside TV blog, AP Simon Cowell said that he hasn't seen a full episode of "American Idol" since he left the program, reports EW.com's Inside TV blog. I've seen three minutes of a recap. From what I've seen and from what I've heard, it all seems to be going well. What I was more concerned about[ was] the ratings falling off a cliff, and that the whole genre might be over, Simon Cowell said, the story notes. The basket gave the 76ers a 99-98 lead, their first since midway through the third quarter. I went to the basket strong and shielded him off with my body, said Lynch, who is eight inches shorter than Shawn Bradley . New All-Star Michael Finley answered with a jumper at 28.4 seconds and appeared to be the hero again for Dallas when he snagged a rebound of Allen Iverson 's miss.

Announcing the plan at a conference in Munich yesterday( 25 January), outgoing chief executive Eric Schmidt says: We looked at this year and our prospects for growth in Europe, and our businesses globally are doing well, both our core business and our adjacent businesses.
